title: The laptop that weighs less than the Apple iPad Pro tablet has been refreshed  —  shame no one noticed
description: Fujitsu’s LIFEBOOK WU-X/H1 weighs just 689g, still making it one of the lightest laptops ever.

title: I was excited about the battery life on the Surface Laptop Studio 2… then I read the small print
description: Microsoft claims its high-end laptop can last 18 hours, but how, exactly, did it reach this figure?

title: CMF by Nothing's new Buds Pro and Watch Pro look like affordable bargains
description: CMF's first products are no slouches as the Watch Pro boasts an 1.96-inch AMOLED display and the Buds Pro have ANC.

title: This super-dangerous Android malware has returned to target US shoppers and bankers
description: Hide your banking apps, hide your crypto wallets, because Xenomorph is coming for everything.

title: Say goodbye to Google Podcasts, you’ll be forced to use YouTube Music by 2024
description: YouTube Music will be the new home for Google Podcasts app users in 2024, according to an announcement from Google.

title: NFT marketplace OpenSea has been hacked, again
description: OpenSea asked its users to replace their API keys following another cyberattack against its business.

title: Microsoft Paint is getting its biggest upgrade in over a decade thanks to Windows Copilot
description: Microsoft expands on its Copilot update, with tons of shiny new Windows 11 tools that are sure to make the user experience much better.

title: LG drops ATSC 3.0 4K tuners from its 2024 OLED TVs and Samsung or Sony could be next
description: LG has lost is battle over a crucial patent, and that means it won't be bringing an important TV tech to its 2024 range.

title: iPhone 15 delays: latest delivery estimates for every model
description: Certain models in Apple's iPhone 15 line are facing lengthy shipping delays. Here are the latest estimates in your region.

title: CISOs are spending more on cybersecurity - but it might not be enough
description: Cybersecurity budgets are growing, but will it be enough? Some experts think not.

title: SAP goes all-in on AI with new Joule copilot
description: New Joule AI copilot will land in all SAP tools and solutions.

title: Resident Evil 4 remake on mobile will cost almost $60, nearly matching its PC and console price
description: Resident Evil 4 remake's iOS pricing has been revealed and will set fans back almost $60 - in the UK, it will cost more than the console and PC versions.

title: Star Wars' Ahsoka Tano is now live in Fortnite alongside a new themed battle pass
description: Ahsoka Tano is officially live in Fortnite alongside a brand-new themed battle pass, she'll also teach you some new Force abilities if you find her in-game.

title: Hideki Kamiya thanks fans for their support after leaving PlatinumGames and says he will keep making games
description: Bayonetta and Devil May Cry creator and director Hideki Kamiya has thanked fans for their support after quitting PlatinumGames.

title: DPUs set to offer new lease of life for Dell PowerEdge servers
description: Dell reveals step towards greater DPU integration by retrofitting older servers with modular upgrade packages.

title: Dune is heading to Netflix very soon, and its arrival would've been perfect but for one issue
description: The best sci-fi movie of 2021 will join Netflix's movie library in October.

title: Sennheiser’s new headphones have the Momentum 4's five-star sound without the high price
description: Fancy the Momentum 4's premium sound without the hefty price tag? The new Sennheiser Accentum could be the headphones you've been waiting for.

title: New report claims Mac is the right choice for business - but we're not entirely convinced
description: New study claims to highlight enterprise benefits of Mac, including potentially lower costs, but are they suitable for your needs?

title: Millions of newborn child registry data entries stolen by another MOVEit hack
description: Ontario's state child registry organization was breached and plenty of sensitive data stolen.

title: Amazon says you might have to pay for Alexa’s AI features in the future
description: Could a ‘superhuman’ AI-powered Alexa be worth paying extra for? Amazon believes it will…

title: Xiaomi 13T and 13T Pro offer flagship specs for mid-range prices
description: The Xiaomi 13T and Xiaomi 13T Pro bring in a fresh set of rear cameras and new chips.

title: Many firms aren't reporting breaches to the proper authorities
description: Survey from Keeper Security finds worrying amount organizations fail to report attacks and breaches.

title: Exploring Starfield's planets was a lot harder before Bethesda "nerfed the hell out of it"
description: Starfield director Todd Howard has revealed that exploring planets was originally a lot harder before Bethesda "nerfed the hell out of it."

title: Some users will find Microsoft’s Bing AI chatbot is suddenly a lot more helpful
description: There’s been a ‘pretty big update’ for one of the main modes of operation for the Bing chatbot.

title: Acer launches a budget gaming laptop that you'll want to check out
description: Acer announced its new gaming laptop, the Acer Nitro V 15, which may be a great budget option for buyers who want solid performance at a reasonable price.

title: Microsoft adds free backup app to Windows 10 - but consumers don't like it
description: The latest feature added to Windows 10, Windows Backup, has received widespread criticism and cannot be easily uninstalled.

title: Good news - SSDs aren’t really getting any less reliable
description: While HDD reliability scores continue to deteriorate, SSDs are holding their ground as a firm favorite.

title: Skullcandy's Dime 3 cheap earbuds are so small, I'd add them to my keyring
description: Ever seen a tiny earbuds case that looks like it could start your car? You have now.

title: Payday 3’s shaky launch has the developers “looking at the possibility of some sort of offline mode”
description: Starbreeze Studios has released a new statement about Payday 3's server issues, and says it's going to make the game "less dependent on online services”.

title: Google Pixel 8 leak suggests it’ll be supported for longer than iPhones
description: Google has been tipped to offer a hefty seven years of Android and security support for the Pixel 8 and Pixel 8 Pro.

title: Spotify's new Jam features lets you listen to playlists with friends
description: Spotify has introduced an upgrade on collaborative playlists with some extra real-time features.

title: Watch out - these popular finance and budgeting apps might be sharing your personal information with others
description: Top budgeting apps are collecting up to 22 different types of data from users, report warns.

title: Canceled KOTOR 2 DLC for Switch sparks class action lawsuit against Aspyr and Saber
description: Developers Aspyr and Saber Interactive caught up in class action lawsuit over canceled Star Wars Knights of the Old Republic 2: Sith Lords DLC.

title: SAG-AFTRA members have voted over 98% in favor of authorizing video game strike
description: SAG-AFTRA has voted to authorize a potential video game strike to negotiate against companies including Activision and EA.

description: The iPhone 16 will reportedly feature a mysterious new 'Capture' button.

title: A new ransomware group says it has breached Sony completely

description: The Google Pixel 8 and Pixel 8 Pro will soon be released, but when exactly?

description: CD Projekt Red has apologized after anti-Russian remarks were spotted in the Ukrainian localization of Cyberpunk 2077.

title: Starfield patches in a round of fixes while sacrificing the infinite money glitch
description: Starfield's infinite money glitch is gone, but at least the game's a lot more stable now.

title: Microsoft could be planning to run future data centers with nuclear power
description: Nuclear energy is being considered to power Microsoft’s cloud and AI data centers next.

title: New PS5 owners based in the U.S. can redeem a free first-party game - here's how
description: New U.S.-based PS5 owners are eligible to redeem one of 12 first-party releases completely free of charge.

title: iOS 17 is resetting some users' privacy settings – and Apple is looking into it
description: A strange bug is affecting some iPhones running iOS 17 and it reactivates iPhone Analytics without first asking for consent
